title: Govinda Kaviraja: Lord Krishnaâ€™s Divine Poet | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Sri Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: Shri Govinda Kaviraj, the brother of Ramachandra Kaviraj, was a great poet who subsequently surrendered his life at the lotus feet of Shri Radha and Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment describes Govinda Kaviraj's birth, family, and early devotion to Goddess Durga.

segments.key_quote: He understood, later he understood that Lord Krishna is the worshipable master of Maa Durga.
segments.summary: This segment narrates the relocation to Talia Budhari, Ramachandra's desire for association with Srinivasa Acharya, and the incident where Durga acknowledges Krishna's supremacy through the lotus offering.

segments.key_quote: Only fools refuse to surrender unto Krishna... for he is the supreme controller and the ultimate protector.
segments.summary: This segment details Govinda's illness, his prayer to Durga, and Durga's instruction to meditate on Krishna's lotus feet for liberation.

segments.key_quote: devi kahe bar bar govinda smarana kare highway nishtara translation suddenly govinda's health
segments.summary: This segment describes Govinda's repentance, his plea to Ramachandra, Srinivasa Acharya's arrival, and Govinda's initiation into the Hare Krishna Mahamantra.

segments.key_quote: govinda kaviraj's poems are so powerful and so intense that many addressed him as the second vidyapati
segments.summary: This segment narrates Govinda's spiritual recovery, his engagement in devotional service, his poetic contributions, and the recognition he received, including the title 'Kaviraj'.
